thread.title: According to fans, FSU Football in for a most interesting spring camp
thread.title_full: According to fans, FSU Football in for a most interesting spring camp

author: Tom Lang
title: According to fans, FSU Football in for a most interesting spring camp
text:
According to fans, FSU Football in for a most interesting spring camp
With under a week to go until 2024 FSU football spring camp — at last! — we posed a simple straw poll question to Warchant subscribers
on our Tribal Council message board: What one player are you most excited to read about and hear about this spring?
The answers paint a fun picture.
Sure, it’s no surprise that quarterback
DJ Uiagalelei earned the most votes of any player. Any time a program turns the reins over to a transfer quarterback, let alone one as experienced as Uiagalelei, intrigue will be high.
But as of Thursday morning, across 21 responses in the thread, 14 different players were named.
Think about that for a moment. Two-thirds of the responses called for updates on different players. That is the definition of a highly interesting camp ahead.
Only three players earned multiple votes: Uiagalelei (six), receiver
Hykeem Williams (two) and linebacker Shawn Murphy (two). Of the 14 players named, Warchant subscribers picked nine players on FSU’s offense and five on the defensive side.
Here are some of our favorite responses from our subscribers, with some light edits for clarity.
QB DJ Uiagalelei
“Offense goes as he does.” — FSUDoles
“He’s replacing Jordan and it’s the most important position on the field. Has his accuracy improved? Can he effectively run the playbook?” — Dave 393
“Most important player.” — FSUkenny
WR Hykeem Williams
“He looks jacked on his Instagram today. He’s putting in this work. Hope to see it pay off this coming year.” — NoleCab30
“I want to see what he does with more reps and another year in the weight and film rooms.” — LastFrontierNole
LB Shawn Murphy
“I want to see
DJ Lundy take the next step in his progression but we know he’s mostly a run stuffer and not great in coverage. Need another LB to step up alongside him.” — Rulli4FSU
DT Darrell Jackson
“Darrell Jackson. We need an All-ACC year from this guy to shore up the middle of the defense. Also will be a huge asset to our LB’s if he’s doing his thing.” — NoleBiz
EDGE Sione Lolohea
“Payton obviously has one of the edge spots tied down. Lolohea is coming in as a fifth-year SR and he was 2nd team All Pac 12 last year. I am assuming that he’s got the inside track to win the other starting edge spot.” — FSU91
EDGE Marvin Jones Jr.
“I’m not sure what to expect from him this season. Just haven’t seen much from him at the college level (good or bad).” — Noles885
Voting Breakdown
- QB DJ Uiagalelei — 6 votes
- WR Hykeem Williams – 2 votes
- LB Shawn Murphy – 2 votes
- DT
Darrell Jackson– 1 vote
- EDGE
Sione Lolohea– 1 vote
- EDGE
Marvin Jones Jr.– 1 vote
- WR
Malik Benson– 1 vote
- OL
Julian Armella– 1 vote
- LB DJ Lundy – 1 vote
- OL
TJ Ferguson– 1 vote
- TE
Landen Thomas– 1 vote
- OT
Lucas Simmons– 1 vote
- WR
Vandrevius Jacobs– 1 vote
- RB
Jaylin Lucas– 1 vote
